alert.note: Alert for Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 26 at 6:45PM EDT until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. High tide is occurring this evening, and will limit effective drainage of another round of approaching heavy rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Florida, including the following county, Duval. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Jacksonville Beach, Atlantic Beach, Neptune Beach, San Pablo, Mayport, Fort Caroline and Craig Field. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
